conclusion: Analyze v-t graph for Car A to determine changes in acceleration direction.
v-t graph with time on horizontal axis and velocity on vertical axis; Car A has two arcs, Car B has a straight line.
Car A's velocity changes over time, Car B's velocity remains constant.
Analyze graph for Car A with two arcs representing velocity change over time.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity; slope of graph gives acceleration.
Two arcs indicate change in slope, meaning acceleration changes direction at intersection.
Direction of acceleration changes when slope changes at arcs' meeting point.
Based on graph, direction of Car A's acceleration changed.
